description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期已撤销的特别行政区。于1914年由北洋政府设立，1928年被国民政府改制为绥远省。
description.en: A former special administrative region during the period of the Republic of China on the mainland. It was established by the Beiyang government in 1914 and reorganized into Suiyuan Province by the Nationalist government in 1928.

description.zh-cn: 东亚的一个共和制国家，于1912年在亚洲大陆成立。绥远特别区是其下属的一个特别行政区。
description.en: A republic in East Asia, founded on the Asian mainland in 1912. The Suiyuan Special Administrative Region was one of its special administrative regions.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初期由北洋军阀掌控的中央政府，于1914年设立绥远特别区。
description.en: The central government of the early Republic of China, controlled by the Beiyang warlords, which established the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region in 1914.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期的一个省。绥远特别区成立前，其下辖的归绥道被划出。
description.en: A province during the Republic of China era. Before the establishment of the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region, its subordinate Guisui Circuit was separated from it.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初期的行政区划，原隶属于山西省，1914年被划入新成立的绥远特别区。
description.en: An administrative division in the early Republic of China, originally under Shanxi Province, which was incorporated into the newly established Suiyuan Special Administrative Region in 1914.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期已撤销的特别区，接收了原归绥道下辖的兴和道。
description.en: A former special region during the mainland period of the Republic of China, which took over the Xinghe Circuit formerly under the Guisui Circuit.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初期的行政区划，原属归绥道，后被划归察哈尔特别区。
description.en: An administrative division in the early Republic of China, originally part of Guisui Circuit, later assigned to Chahar Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 一个蒙古部落及行政区域，其辖地于1914年被划归绥远特别区。
description.en: A Mongol tribe and administrative area whose territory was incorporated into the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region in 1914.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初期绥远地区的最高军事及行政长官职位，负责管辖绥远特别区。
description.en: The highest military and administrative position in the Suiyuan area during the early Republic of China, responsible for governing the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 内蒙古历史上的一个盟，其所属各旗于1914年被划归绥远特别区。
description.en: A historical league in Inner Mongolia, whose banners were incorporated into the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region in 1914.

description.zh-cn: 内蒙古历史上的一个盟，其所属各旗于1914年被划归绥远特别区。
description.en: A historical league in Inner Mongolia, whose banners were incorporated into the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region in 1914.

description.zh-cn: 1914年7月在绥远特别区内设立的行政区划。
description.en: An administrative division established within the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region in July 1914.

description.zh-cn: 1928年北伐后取代北洋政府的中华民国中央政府，同年将绥远特别区改制为绥远省。
description.en: The central government of the Republic of China that replaced the Beiyang government after the Northern Expedition in 1928, and reorganized the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region into Suiyuan Province in the same year.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期的一个省份，由绥远特别区于1928年改制而来。
description.en: A province during the Republic of China era, transformed from the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region in 1928.

description.zh-cn: 绥远特别区的首府。
description.en: The capital of the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的一个自治区，其现今地域包含了原绥远特别区的大部分。
description.en: An autonomous region of the People's Republic of China, whose current territory includes most of the former Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期的一种行政区划概念，绥远特别区即为此类型。
description.en: An administrative division concept during the mainland period of the Republic of China, of which the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region was an example.

description.zh-cn: 民国三年（1914年）1月，北洋政府设立绥远特别区。
description.en: In January 1914, the Beiyang government established the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 在1914年1月之前，归绥道由山西省管辖。
description.en: Before January 1914, the Guisui Circuit was administered by Shanxi Province.

description.zh-cn: 1914年1月，原属山西省的归绥道各县被划归新成立的绥远特别区。
description.en: In January 1914, the counties of the Guisui Circuit, formerly part of Shanxi Province, were incorporated into the newly established Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 1914年1月，归化城土默特辖地被划归绥远特别区。
description.en: In January 1914, the territory of Guihua Tümed was incorporated into the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 1914年1月，伊克昭盟所属各旗被划归绥远特别区。
description.en: In January 1914, the banners belonging to the Ikh Chao League were incorporated into the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 1914年1月，乌兰察布盟所属各旗被划归绥远特别区。
description.en: In January 1914, the banners belonging to the Ulanqab League were incorporated into the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 绥远特别区由绥远都统管辖。
description.en: The Suiyuan Special Administrative Region was administered by the Suiyuan Military Governor.

description.zh-cn: 原属归绥道的兴和道在1914年被划归察哈尔特别区。
description.en: The Xinghe Circuit, formerly part of the Guisui Circuit, was assigned to the Chahar Special Administrative Region in 1914.

description.zh-cn: 1914年7月，绥远特别区内设立了绥远道。
description.en: In July 1914, the Suiyuan Circuit was established within the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 绥远道是绥远特别区下辖的行政单位。
description.en: The Suiyuan Circuit was a subordinate administrative unit of the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 民国十七年（1928年），国民政府北伐后，撤销了绥远特别区。
description.en: In 1928, after the Northern Expedition, the Nationalist Government abolished the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 1928年，国民政府将绥远特别区改制为绥远省。
description.en: In 1928, the Nationalist Government reorganized the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region into Suiyuan Province.

description.zh-cn: 绥远特别区于1928年被改制为绥远省。
description.en: The Suiyuan Special Administrative Region was reorganized into Suiyuan Province in 1928.

description.zh-cn: 归绥市是绥远特别区的首府。
description.en: Guisui City was the capital of the Suiyuan Special Administrative Region.

description.zh-cn: 绥远特别区的地域现今主要属于内蒙古自治区。
description.en: The territory of the former Suiyuan Special Administrative Region is now mainly part of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region.
